author: DH Web Desk
title: JNU wall sprayed with 'Rebuild Babri Masjid' message ahead of mega Ram Temple consecration in January
text:
The walls of Jawaharlal Nehru University were sprayed with messages calling for reconstruction of Babri Masjid ahead of mega Ram Temple consecration ceremony scheduled in January 22.
Photos of the graffiti were discovered by students on Wednesday night. Graffiti was sprayed on the first floor of School of Language and the message read 'Rebuild Babri Masjid 6 December'. 'NSUI' (National Students' Union of India), was also mentioned below.
As the seemingly NSUI attribution sparked controversy, the student body denied any involvement in the act and stated that the message is part of a conspiracy to defame both the campus and NSUI.
JNU unit president Sudhanshu Shekhar said that the NSUI's name was already present in black marker and that the slogans were added above it later in red marker, The Times of India reported .
The student body called for stringent action against those involved in the act after an investigation.
Naveen Yadav, the chief security officer of JNU, claimed to have no knowledge of the incident. He mentioned that a few months ago, there were also slogans written targeting a specific caste, but no investigation was conducted at that time.
In October this year, a similar incident took place where messages such as "Free Kashmir," "Teri Kabra Khudegi" (Grave of yours will be dug), and "Bhagwa Jalega" were sprayed on the walls of a building within the university.
Slogans like "There will be blood" were also sprayed on the walls of the School of Languages and School of International Studies at the university earlier.
Satish Garkoti, rector of JNU, had said in October that a committee would look into repeated incidents of "anti-national" slogans on its campus. He had further stated that the committee was collaborating with the deans of various schools to gradually install CCTV cameras in strategic areas.
However, it was said that it was not feasible to have CCTV cameras installed throughout the entire campus at once.

author: Rebekah Riess, CNN
title: Florida priest accused of biting woman during dispute over Communion bread
text:
(CNN) — A Florida priest is accused of biting a woman while giving out Communion during a Mass in St. Cloud in an alleged “attempt to defend the Communion bread,” according to the charging affidavit in the case.
The priest, identified as Father Fidel Rodriguez, initially refused to give the woman Communion bread on May 19 and told her “she did not do the prior steps necessary” to receive the bread when he encountered her at a Mass held earlier that day at St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church, according to police.
A statement provided by the Diocese of Orlando states Rodriguez gave the woman a blessing at the 10 a.m. Mass and “advised her to receive the Sacrament of Penance (Confession) before coming back to receive Holy Communion (Eucharist).”
The woman told police she returned to the church for the noon Mass and informed the priest she had in fact done the necessary steps and “is now accepted by God, thus, granting her the ability to participate in communion,” the affidavit states.
The priest asked the woman if she “had been to the Sacrament of Penance (Confession), to which she stated it was not his business,” according to the statement from the Diocese.
The woman told police Rodriguez allegedly “became upset and tried to ram the ‘cookie’ in her mouth,” according to the affidavit. She said she then attempted to grab another Communion bread, which the priest was holding, when he grabbed and bit her arm, the affidavit states.
“Father Rodriguez offered the woman Holy Communion on the tongue. At that point, the woman forcefully placed her hand in the vessel and grabbed some sacred Communion hosts, crushing them,” according to the Diocese’s statement on the incident.
“Having only one hand free, Father Rodriguez struggled to restrain the woman as she refused to let go of the hosts. When the woman pushed him and reacting to a perceived act of aggression, Father Rodriguez bit her hand so she would let go of the hosts she grabbed,” the statement continued.
The woman was asked to leave, according to the Diocese, which added the priest had not met her before.
When interviewed by police, the priest told the investigating officer the woman had pushed him and “would not let go of the communion tray and the only way he thought to extract her from it was to bite her arm,” according to the affidavit.
“In the Catholic Tradition, the Eucharist is considered ‘the source and summit’ of worship and faith. The act of participation in Holy Communion therefore calls for a proper understanding, reverence, and devotion,” the statement from the Diocese reads.
“It is not something a person can arbitrarily demand and is certainly not a mere ‘cookie’ as the complainant called it,” the statement adds.
The woman refused medical attention and police photographed the bite mark, according to the affidavit.
St. Cloud Police have forwarded the affidavit summary of events to the State Attorney’s Office for review.
The Ninth Judicial Circuit State Attorney’s Office told CNN in a statement on Friday, “We have received the case and it is currently under review to determine the appropriate course of action.”

text: CINCINNATI (WKRC) - There will be no [Cincinnati Home + Garden Show](https://www.cincinnatihomeandgardenshow.com/information) next year due to the [ Duke Energy Convention Center closure](https://local12.com/news/local/work-begins-cincinnati-convention-center-expansion-renovation-hotel-commissioners-denise-drihaus-stephanie-dumas-summerow-alicia-reece-tourism-business-construction-tax-credits). The show will return in 2026, according to organizer Marketplace Events. Marketplace Events (MPE) tried to find another venue for the show but could not due to its space and logistical needs. “After an extensive search, we ultimately determined that alternate venue options did not provide adequate space nor dates suitable for us to run a two-weekend show” said Marketplace Events Vice Chairman Tom Baugh in a news release. “This led to our decision to wait until we could produce the high-quality show the Greater Cincinnati community knows and expects. We look forward to hosting a wonderful show in 2026.” MPE’s other local show, the Greater Cincinnati Holiday Market, will be held this year at the Sharonville Convention Center

title: Indian Online Visa Simplifying Travel For Luxembourg, Bolivia, Albania, Mexico and Chile Citizens
text:
India Online Visa is pleased to announce the extension of its online visa program to people of Luxembourg, Chile, Albania, Mexico, and Bolivia in an endeavor to enhance travel and cultural exchange. With this project, we hope to strengthen our international ties and highlight the enriching experiences that travelers from around the world can have in India. Citizens of these nations can now access the Indian online visa system, which simplifies the application process for a variety of visa categories. Those looking to see the varied landscapes, rich cultural legacy, and historical riches of India will have an easier time getting their visas.
INDIAN VISA FOR LUXEMBOURG CITIZENS
Since 2014, the availability of the Indian Visa in electronic mode has been extended to Luxembourg nationals. The India e-Visa, a government-issued document, facilitates entry and travel to India for residents and citizens of Luxembourg. Online applications are accepted from Luxembourg, simplifying the overall process. Currently, more than 169 countries are eligible to apply for an Indian e-Visa. Introduced in 2017, the visa aims to streamline the process, saving time and money for tourists.
Foreigners visiting India for pleasure, tourism, or short-term medical treatment have the option to apply for an eVisa. A Tourist visa, valid for a single entrance, allows a 30-day stay. For those desiring an extended stay in India for leisure purposes, Long-Term Tourist eVisas for 1 year and 5 years are available. These visas permit multiple entries during their validity period, with each stay limited to 90 days.
An e-business visa, offering multiple entries, allows a 365-day stay, with a maximum continuous stay of 180 days per visit. Medical e-visas and Physician Assistant e-visas enable three entries into India for medical treatment or accompanying family members, allowing a total stay of 60 days from the first arrival date. The application process for the online Indian e-Visa is quick, taking only a few minutes to complete.
Indian Visa Requirements for citizens of Luxembourg
- A valid Passport that is valid for 6 months
- A valid Email address to receive the e-visa in their Inbox.
- They can use a Credit/Debit Card or PayPal Account to pay for the e-visa fees.
INDIAN VISA FOR CHILE CITIZENS
In 2015, alterations to the visa procedure by the Indian government resulted in the extension of online travel authorization to 169 nations, including Chile. This modification allowed citizens of Chile to efficiently apply for electronic visas. Before entering India, individuals are required to present a valid passport and a visa as proof of identity. Since 2014, an online application form for Indian visas has been made accessible to Chileans.
Chilean citizens now have a quicker and more convenient process for applying for a travel permit to India. There are three types of e-Visas available to Chileans: the e-Tourist Visa, the e-Business Visa, and the e-Medical Visa. The Tourist visa is suitable for those intending to visit India for tourism purposes, allowing a vacation, family reunion, sightseeing, or retreat for up to 90 days. The E-Business Visa caters to individuals with business-related visits, offering a stay of up to 180 days for attending meetings, initiating business ventures, hiring staff, or delivering lectures. The e-Medical Visa is designed for travelers seeking medical treatment in India, providing a maximum stay of 60 days and allowing a total of three visits.
Before completing the visa application, applicants should verify the specific Indian visa requirements applicable to Chilean citizens. The convenience of online applications eliminates the need for Chilean citizens to schedule an appointment with the Indian Embassy for a Tourist Visa. The entire application process, including fee payment and document submission, can be efficiently completed online, ensuring a faster and more convenient experience.
Indian Visa Requirements for Citizens of Chile
- A valid passport and a complete scan of the information page.
- A digital passport photo.
- A valid email address to receive the eVisa in their Inbox.
- They can use a credit/debit card or PayPal account to pay for their visa fees.
INDIAN VISA FOR ALBANIA CITIZENS
Albanians, in addition to undertaking pilgrimages, plan vacations to India, benefiting from the friendly relations maintained between Albania and India. The Indian authorities mandate obtaining a visa before visiting the country. However, obtaining an Indian visa has become more accessible for Albanians since 2014. The Indian government introduced an online application form for Indian visas specifically designed for Albanian citizens, streamlining the process.
The online document, akin to a paper visa, grants entry into the country. Notably, unlike a traditional paper visa, this online process eliminates the need to visit the embassy in person. In 2015, the Indian government revamped its visa process, extending online travel authorization to 169 countries, including Albania, thereby facilitating e-visa applications for Albanian citizens.
Albanian citizens now have the option to apply for three distinct types of India e-Visas: the e-Tourist Visa, the e-Business Visa, or the e-Medical Visa. The Tourist e-Visa, valid for 30 days with a double entry, cannot be extended or converted. For longer stays, Albanian citizens may opt for a 1-year or 5-year Tourist e-visa, allowing multiple entries with a maximum stay of 1 year or 5 years, provided each stay does not exceed 90 days.
The E-Business Visa, valid for 365 days from the date of Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) issuance, permits a stay of 365 days, with multiple entry options available. The Electronic Medical Visa is issued to Albanian citizens requiring medical treatment in India, allowing three entries and a maximum stay of 60 days from the date of arrival.
Previously requiring a visit to the Indian Embassy, the entire application process for these e-Visas can now be completed conveniently from home using a computer or smartphone, connected to a WiFi connection, enabling Albanians to apply for their Indian e-Visa online within minutes.
Indian Visa Requirements for citizens of Albania
- Citizens need a valid passport that is valid for 6 months
- A recent photograph
- A valid email address to receive the eVisa in their Inbox.
- They can use PayPal or a debit/credit card so they can pay for the visa fees.
INDIAN VISA FOR MEXICO CITIZENS
India stands as one of South Asia’s premier tourist destinations, and for those traveling from Mexico, the journey has become notably simpler. Mexico is among the 169 nations whose citizens qualify for the India e-Visa, making the process of obtaining a visa for Mexico straightforward. Prospective visitors can apply for a visa online and secure approval before departing from Mexico, offering a convenient approach.
While Mexico isn’t part of India’s visa waiver nations, the application for an India e-Visa is accessible for Mexican citizens. Since 2014, the Indian government has made the Indian Visa application form available online specifically for Mexican citizens. Various types of India e-Visas cater to different activities such as tourism, business travel, family visits, and short-term medical treatment.
For instance, the India Single Entry tourist Visa allows a stay of up to 90 days and covers activities like tourism, family visits, or stays at wellness retreats. Travelers have a one-year window after visa approval to enter India. The Double Entry eBusiness Visa is designed for those on business trips, permitting a total stay of up to 180 days. Similar to the tourist visa, business visa holders have one year to enter India upon visa approval, with the flexibility to engage in activities like attending business meetings, guided tours, or participating in business fairs or exhibitions.
Mexican citizens can also opt for an eMedical Visa to India, allowing three entries for short-term medical treatment, with a maximum stay of 60 days. The online application process for the India e-Visa is user-friendly, eliminating the need to personally visit an Indian Embassy or Consulate. The entire application and approval process can be completed efficiently in as little as two business days, thanks to the streamlined online system.
Indian Visa Requirements for citizens of Mexico
- Passport: take a look at the expiration date to make sure that it is valid for at least six months’ validity remaining after their expected date of arrival in India.
- Digital photo of traveler: this photo must be as recent as possible.
- A complete passport scan of the information page
- Payment means: Travelers can use a debit or credit card.
- Business card copy and invitation letter: if necessary, especially when applying for the Business eVisa.
- Letter from the hospital in India: only if they apply for the Medical eVisa.
INDIAN VISA FOR BOLIVIA CITIZENS
Bolivians have the opportunity to enter and travel to India for tourism, business, or medical purposes through the utilization of the official document known as the India e-Visa, issued by the Indian government. Since 2014, citizens of Bolivia have been eligible to electronically apply for an Indian visa. To facilitate a quick and easy entry into the country, individuals from Bolivia will need an e-Visa for India, an accessible digital document online. It is imperative for Bolivian nationals intending to visit India to secure approval from the Indian government, with the e-Visa, also referred to as the Indian e-Visa, being accessible to citizens of 169 different countries.
For those applying for an India Tourist visa, it is important to note that the visa remains valid for a year from the date of issuance, with a maximum stay of 90 days per entry following arrival. The E-Business Visa, valid for 365 days from the date of Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) issuance, allows a stay of 365 days, but continuous stays cannot exceed 180 days. Multiple entry options are available for this type of visa. Additionally, the Electronic Medical Visa is issued to Bolivian citizens requiring medical treatment in India, permitting three entries and a maximum stay of 60 days from the date of arrival.
Obtaining travel documents has been made convenient as individuals can now acquire them from the comfort of their homes or any location. The online process has significantly streamlined the visa application steps and reduced processing time.
Indian Visa Requirements for citizens of Bolivia
- Valid passport: must be valid for at least 6 months.
- Digital photo: this picture must be as recent as possible. Citizens can get help with the requirements for this photo on our professional passport service.
- A complete scan of the passport’s information page.
- Payment options: Citizens can use their credit or debit card or even PayPal to pay for the visa fees.
- A valid email address to receive the eVisa in their Inbox.
- Business card copy and invitation letter: only if they apply for the India business e-Visa.
- Letter from the hospital in India: this is necessary if they want to apply for an Indian medical e-visa.

title: Matan y arrojan a dos con mensaje amenazante en Cuauhtémoc
text:
Este jueves, un trágico hallazgo tuvo lugar a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuauhtémoc, en la zona del Libramiento a Gómez Morín, donde 2 personas sin vida fueron localizadas cerca de la cinta asfáltica, además de encontrar en la escena un mensaje amenazante.
De acuerdo con el reporte, el hallazgo se registró luego de que a los servicios de emergencia llegara una llamada donde se notificaba sobre la localización de dos personas fallecidas a las afueras de la ciudad.
Elementos de seguridad se movilizaron al lugar mencionado por el Libramiento Gómez Morín donde confirmaron los hechos, encontrando a los hoy fallecidos.
Ante esta situación, acordonaron la zona e iniciaron con el análisis de la escena del crimen, encontrando un mensaje amenazante.
Finalmente, tras las primeras indagatorias, el Servicio Médico Forense fue el encargado de levantar y trasladar los cuerpos a fin de realizarles la necropsia de ley.
Hasta el momento se desconoce la causa de muerte de estas personas así como su identidad.

Se les prohíbe salir de Teherán sin autorización previa y no pueden visitar ciertas áreas del país.Religión: Se les permite practicar el judaísmo, pero con limitaciones. Las sinagogas están sujetas a vigilancia y no se permite la proselitización.Propiedad: No pueden poseer propiedades en Irán.Educación: No pueden asistir a universidades públicas.Empleo: Se les restringe el acceso a la mayoría de los trabajos.En general, los israelíes en Irán son considerados ciudadanos de segunda clase y son objeto de discriminación por parte del gobierno.
Pasaporte:
Debido a que no se les permite tener la ciudadanía iraní, los israelíes en Irán no pueden obtener un pasaporte iraní. En cambio, deben usar un pasaporte extranjero para viajar.
Uno diría que los Iraníes tratan a los Israelíes en Irán de la misma manera que Israel trata a los Israelíes musulmanes en Israel.
en menor medida, el futbol y la politica. hay veces que la gente busca cualquier excusa para odiarte. en meneame muchos empiezan sus respuestas atribuyendote un color politico para proceder a soltar bilis.
La religión es un elemento identitario más. En nuestro instinto está el de pertenecer a un grupo con el que luchar por recursos y defendernos de otros grupos.
Religión, raza, idioma, folclore, son muchas cosas las que si bien en principio pueden no tener un impacto negativo, sí que sirven para reforzar esos vínculos y luchar contra un enemigo.
Que no estoy en contra ni creo positivo unificar todo en una misma cultura. Pero es obvio que sirve para marcar límites definir bandos y motivar a una sociedad hacia la confrontación.

author: Texas Tribune, Robert Downen
title: Southern Baptist Convention settles high-profile lawsuit that accused former leader of sexual abuse
text: [Sign up for The Brief](https://www.texastribune.org/newsletters/the-brief/?utm_medium=website&utm_source=trib-ads-owned&utm_campaign=trib-marketing&utm_term=inline-CTA-brief), The Texas Tribune’s daily newsletter that keeps readers up to speed on the most essential Texas news. The Southern Baptist Convention and others have reached a confidential settlement in a high-profile lawsuit that accused a former leader of sexual assault, ending a six-year legal drama that expanded victims’ rights in Texas, helped prompt a broader reckoning over child sexual abuse in evangelical churches and showed that a prominent conservative activist and Texas House candidate [repeatedly downplayed](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) abuse allegations. In 2017, Duane Rollins filed the lawsuit accusing Paul Pressler, a longtime Southern Baptist figure and former Texas judge, of decades of rape beginning when Rollins was a 14-year-old member of Pressler’s church youth group in Houston. Rollins claimed in court documents that the alleged attacks pushed him into drug and alcohol addictions that kept him in prison throughout much of his adult life. After disclosing the alleged rapes to a prison psychiatrist, Rollins filed the suit in Harris County against Pressler along with other defendants who he accused of enabling or concealing Pressler’s behavior — including the Southern Baptist Convention and Jared Woodfill, the former chair of the Harris County GOP and Pressler’s longtime law partner. Rollins’ claims were a key impetus for “ [Abuse of Faith](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/investigations/abuse-of-faith/),” a 2019 investigation by the Houston Chronicle and San Antonio Express-News into sexual abuse in the SBC, the nation’s second-largest faith group. The series [led to](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/investigations/article/Southern-Baptist-sex-abuse-timeline-17194777.php) major reforms in the SBC, revelations that top leaders had routinely ignored or [downplayed warnings](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/investigations/article/Bombshell-400-page-report-finds-Southern-Baptist-17190816.php) about a sexual abuse crisis, and an ongoing Department of Justice investigation. As part of Rollins' suit, at least seven other men came forward with their own allegations of [sexual misconduct](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/More-men-accuse-former-Texas-judge-Baptist-12831892.php) by Pressler in incidents spanning four decades. The suit also showed that Woodfill, a prominent anti-LGBTQ+ activist, was [aware of allegations](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) that Pressler was a sexual predator but continued to provide him with young, male personal assistants who worked out of Pressler’s River Oaks home. Three of the men have [alleged sexual abuse](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) or misconduct. Woodfill is [currently running](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/11/17/texas-house-jared-woodfill/) for a Texas House seat against incumbent Rep. [Lacey Hull](https://www.texastribune.org/directory/lacey-hull/), R-Houston, and has been endorsed by Attorney General Ken Paxton and Agriculture Commissioner Sid Miller. Pressler, 93, is one of the most influential evangelical figures of the last half-century, and is considered the co-architect of the SBC’s “conservative resurgence” that began in the late 1970s and prompted the faith group to adopt literal interpretations of the Bible, align more closely with the Republican Party, ban women from preaching and strongly condemn homosexuality. Pressler — who formerly represented Houston in the Texas House and served for 14 years as a state appeals court judge — is also an influential figure in GOP politics. His [endorsement](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2015/05/16/long-time-texas-conservative-activist-endorses-cruz-for-president/) has for years been sought by conservative evangelical politicians, including U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas. In 1989, Pressler was nominated to lead the Office of Government Ethics under President George H.W. Bush, though the bid was later withdrawn; and Pressler is a founding member of Council for National Policy, a secretive network of conservative judges, politicians, media figures, megadonors and wealthy business owners that is currently led by Tony Perkins, head of the anti-LGBTQ+ Family Research Council. Pressler denies the allegations and has not been criminally charged for any of the alleged abuses. An attorney for Pressler did not respond to a requests for comment about the settlement, which is not public. In a statement, legal representatives for the Southern Baptist Convention and its executive committee confirmed that they had “entered into a confidential settlement agreement” despite being “fully prepared” to proceed to the trial for the suit, which was scheduled for February after being postponed twice this year. “However, several factors ultimately made settlement the more prudent choice,” they wrote. “Chief among those factors was the horrendous nature of the abuse allegations, the likelihood that counsel for the SBC and Executive Committee would have to confront and cross-examine abuse survivors, the Executive Committee’s current financial condition, and the willingness of multiple insurance carriers to contribute to the terms of the settlement.” Michael Goldberg, who represented Rollins along with a team of lawyers from Baker Botts, said Friday that they had resolved the matter with Pressler on "mutually satisfactory terms," and added that their team was "very proud of the settlement we reached against the Southern Baptist Convention and Jared Woodfill." Woodfill has denied wrongdoing and said this week that he has not settled the case, though a Harris County judge signed off on a motion last week that said “all claims, counterclaims and controversies” in the suit were resolved. "We are fighting the insurance company and oppose any payment,” Woodfill said in a text message on Thursday. A pattern The settlement almost never happened. By the time that Rollins disclosed the alleged abuses to a prison psychiatrist in 2016 and was diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder as a “direct result of the childhood sexual trauma he suffered,” the statute of limitations for filing a lawsuit against Pressler had long passed. Nevertheless, Rollins pushed forward with the suit, arguing that the alleged rapes by Pressler — a spiritual mentor who Rollins said weaponized religious language to justify his predations — were so traumatizing that he unconsciously developed a sort of Stockholm syndrome that made it impossible to recognize himself as a victim until decades had passed. Thus, Rollins argued, his statute of limitations should have begun when he realized he had been abused, rather than when the last assault occurred. His lawsuit was initially dismissed on statute grounds. But Rollins appealed and, eventually, had the [dismissal overturned](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Texas-Supreme-Court-rules-against-Southern-17076007.php) by the Texas Supreme Court, which agreed with Rollins’ arguments.. The court’s opinion was a [major victory](https://cmf.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Texas-Supreme-Court-rules-against-Southern-17076007.php) for sexual abuse victims and their advocates, who have for years pointed to research that shows child sexual trauma can remap developing brains and make it difficult for many survivors to come forward until after their 50th birthday, and after their standing to file lawsuits has elapsed. Rollins’ lawsuit also uncovered a [40-year pattern](https://cmf.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/More-men-accuse-former-Texas-judge-Baptist-12831892.php) of alleged abuses by Pressler. As part of the suit, a former member of Pressler’s youth group said in a sworn affidavit that Pressler [molested him](https://cmf.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/More-men-accuse-former-Texas-judge-Baptist-12831892.php) in 1977 while the two were in a sauna at the country club in Houston’s tony River Oaks neighborhood. The man was entering his sophomore year in college at the time; Pressler, meanwhile, was a youth pastor at a Presbyterian church in Houston. He was ousted from that position in 1978 after church officials received information about “an alleged incident,” according to a letter introduced into the court file. Soon after, Pressler ramped up his involvement in Southern Baptist life. Rollins said Pressler began sexually abusing him not long after. He said the rapes continued on and off for nearly a quarter-century, often while he was working as Pressler’s aide. In 2004, court records show that a small group of leaders at First Baptist Church of Houston were made aware of allegations that Pressler, a powerful deacon at the church, had undressed and groped a young man at his home. In a [letter to Pressler](https://static.texastribune.org/media/files/b74f68bf318353337489d4432ae222c0/FBC%20Houston%20email%20REDACTED.pdf) that was unearthed as part of Rollins’ lawsuit, the church leaders condemned Pressler’s "morally and spiritually" inappropriate behavior. They also feared that publicizing the allegations would [damage Pressler's reputation](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) in their church and the Southern Baptist Convention. An attorney for First Baptist Church of Houston, which was a defendant in Rollins’ lawsuit, did not respond to a request for comment Thursday about the lawsuit settlement. The church has [previously defended](https://www.baptistpress.com/resource-library/news/houstons-first-baptist-responds-to-claims-in-pressler-case/) its handling of the 2004 incident, saying that there were differing accounts of what happened and that Pressler’s position on church committees and as a teacher were eliminated as a result. The same year that First Baptist was made aware of those allegations, Rollins filed a lawsuit for non-sexual assault against Pressler that was quickly settled for $450,000. Woodfill, who represented Pressler in the matter, said [under oath last year](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) that he was told by Rollins’ attorney at the time that Pressler had sexually abused Rollins as a child. Despite that, Woodfill continued to lean on Pressler’s conservative reputation, connections and influence to bolster their law firm, providing him with the young, male personal assistants despite Pressler doing almost no work. “I can think of one or two cases that he brought in,” [Woodfill testified](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/) as part of Rollins’ new lawsuit last year. “He may have gone to one hearing in his entire time with us, two at the most. Really, it was his name. … He got an employee that worked for him. So he didn’t get a salary. He didn’t get a draw. He didn’t get a bonus. We paid for someone to come and assist him. That’s how he got compensated.” Woodfill [similarly downplayed](https://cmf.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/More-men-accuse-former-Texas-judge-Baptist-12831892.php) sexual misconduct allegations in 2016, after a 25-year-old lawyer at his firm alerted Woodfill that Pressler had told him “lewd stories about being naked on beaches with young men” and then invited him to skinny-dip at his ranch, court records show. The attorney said he addressed the incident with a longtime employee of Woodfill’s law firm, who made it clear that this was not the first time he’d heard such allegations. “I discovered that this was not unusual behavior for Pressler, and that he had a long history of lecherous behavior towards young men. Even going as far as bringing scantily clad men and parading them through the office,” the attorney wrote in an affidavit that was filed as part of Rollins’ lawsuit. Woodfill — who’d just played a key role defeating an equal rights ordinance for LGBTQ Houstonians — responded to the young man’s request for help with shock. “This 85-year-old man has never made any inappropriate comments or actions toward me or any one I know of,” [he responded](https://www.texastribune.org/2023/03/27/houston-jared-woodfill-gop-paul-pressler-southern-baptist/), court records show. The young attorney’s claims are similar in detail to those from other Pressler accusers, who said he leaned on his stature and connections in conservative religious and political circles to try and coerce them into lewd massages, naked swimming sessions or sex. One accuser — a young Houston Baptist University student — said in a sworn affidavit that he stopped pursuing a career in ministry, frequently had panic attacks and attempted suicide as a result of Pressler’s alleged behavior. Court filings also show that Pressler’s family was alerted about his behavior in 2017, when an aide claimed in a letter that he had “both heard stories of and personally witnessed” Pressler getting nude massages from “young men who work for him.” He also claimed that Pressler had recently bragged about skinny-dipping with three boys who were younger than 10, and that he had seen Pressler “manipulate” a 20-year-old into giving him a massage and then repeatedly kiss him. “He talks way more about nudity, the male body, being naked in spas in Europe, being naked in general than God, or his Baptist background,” the aide wrote before announcing his resignation. Pressler, he added, “needs to be stopped.”

title: Sarthe. Un nouveau dispositif pour stocker le carbone dans les haies
text:
Voir mon actu Suivre Les Alpes Mancelles Le Département de la Sarthe a engagé une démarche de stockage de carbone dans les haies en accompagnant les exploitants agricoles vers une meilleure gestion des haies bocagères.
Un accompagnement qui se concrétise par un plan nommé « Carbocage » conduit par l’association Solenat.
Un agriculteur convaincu à Tennie Le mardi 24 septembre, les partenaires de ce dispositif, étaient en visite sur le domaine de Franck Champion , éleveur à Tennie , pour parler du projet « Carbocage ».
À lire aussi
La gestion des haies, pomme de discorde entre les élus de Valdallière Claire Faivet , conseillère à la Chambre d’agriculture de la Sarthe, spécialiste en agroforestier et Philippe Dutertre, vice-président de la Chambre d’agriculture Pays de Loire Sarthe, ont retracé le bilan de l’opération et fait un point de son application sur l’exploitation de Franck Champion, agriculteur très convaincu de la nécessité et de l’utilité des haies dans une exploitation agricole.
Un plan de gestion et un suivi technique Ce projet s’appuie sur la méthode haie du label Bas carbone , avec comme objectif, d’optimiser la séquestration du carbone et les autres qualités écologiques des haies (biodiversité, qualité de l’eau, lutte contre l’érosion) par des méthodes adaptées.
Vidéos : en ce moment sur Actu À lire aussi
En Normandie, la haie qui borde leur maison est coupée en leur absence : « Je trouve ça dégoûtant » Sa mission : identifier les agriculteurs volontaires, réaliser avec eux un plan de gestion durable des haies de leur exploitation sur 15 ans, en assurer le suivi technique pour, au final réaliser un audit permettant d’obtenir des certificats crédit carbone.
Une méthode incitative Dans le projet, « Carbocage » a mis en place une méthode incitative pour les agriculteurs. C’est pour leurs propriétés en matière de stockage de carbone que ces végétaux sont valorisés.
À lire aussi
La haie et la pelouse du voisin empiètent sur son terrain, une habitante exaspérée à Saint-Sulpice-sur-Risle Ainsi, 100 t équivalent CO2 pourraient être séquestrées par les haies sur une période de 5 ans. Les agriculteurs sont payés 92 € la tonne équivalent CO2. Sur les terres de Franck Champion, 7 km de haies sont concernées par ce dispositif.
Cette action de gestion durable des haies est réalisée dans 9 exploitations sarthoises. Le département de la Sarthe contribue à hauteur de 400 000€ pour la totalité du partenariat « Carbocage ».
Suivez toute l’actualité de vos villes et médias favoris en vous inscrivant à Mon Actu .
